title: VSCode Liquid Extension Configuration
markdownDescription: Accepts formatting rules and options that will be passed to Prettify

correct.title: Fix Sloppy Code
correct.markdownDescription: Automatically attempts to correct some sloppiness in code. Use this option with care, it may wreak havoc in some cases.

attributeSort.title: Sort Attributes
attributeSort.markdownDescription: Alphanumerically sort HTML attributes from A to Z.

attributeSortList.title: Sort Attribute List
attributeSortList.markdownDescription: A list of HTML attribute names. Attributes will be sorted according to this list and then alphanumerically. This option requires "attribute_sort" have a value of true and does not support Liquid tag names, only HTML names are applicable.

A list of HTML attribute names. Attributes will be sorted according to this list and then alphanumerically. This option requires `attribute_sort` have a value of `true` and does not accept Liquid tag names, only HTML names are applicable.

delimiterSpacing.markdownDescription: Whether or not delimiter characters should apply a single space at the start and end points.

commentNewline.markdownDescription: This will determine whether comments should always start at position 0 of each line or if comments should be indented according to the code.
This will determine whether comments should always start at position `0` of each line or if comments should be indented according to the code.

forceLeadAttribute.markdownDescription:
**_FORCE LEAD ATTRIBUTE_** _Whether the leading attribute should be forced onto a newline when word `wrap` limit is exceeded or if it should be preserved. By default, Prettify preserves the leading attribute when applying wrap indentation. Enabling this option will force indent all attributes if wrap is exceeded._ _This rule requires a `wrap` level to be defined. If you have `forceAttribute` enabled or using a force attribute limit value it will override this option. If you desire wrap based attribute indentation, set `forceAttribute` to `false` and ensure a `wrap` level is defined._ --- #### Disabled (default) Below is an example of how this rule works if it's disabled (ie: `false`) and attributes have exceeded a defined wrap limit. Notice how leading attributes are preserved that have not exceeded wrap, but proceeding attributes are indented onto their own lines, this is the default behavior Prettify uses.* ```liquid
``` --- #### Enabled Below is an example of how this rule works if it's enabled (ie: `true`) and attributes have exceeded the defined wrap limit. Notice how all attributes and indented onto their own line, including the leading attribute. ```liquid
```

forceIndent.markdownDescription: **_FORCE INDENT_** _Will force indentation upon all content and tags without regard for the text nodes._ #### Disabled   üëé ```liquid Hello World ``` --- #### Enabled   üëç ```liquid Hello World ```

forceAttribute.markdownDescription:
**_FORCE ATTRIBUTE_** _Whether all markup attributes should be indented each onto their own line. You can optionally provide an integer value of `1` or more. When an integer value is passed, attributes will be forced only if the number of attributes contained on the tag exceeds the supplied value limit. When you define a `wrap` level then attributes will be automatically forced. This is typically a better solution than forcing all attributes onto newlines or an even better solution would be to set a limit level._ --- #### Disabled   üëé Below is the default, wherein attributes are only forced when wrap is exceeded. ```liquid
``` --- #### Enabled   üëç Below is an example of how this rule works if it's enabled, ie: `true` ```liquid
``` --- #### Limit Example   üëç üëç *Below we provide a value of `2` so formatting will be applied as such:* ```liquid
```

preserveText.title: Preserve Markup Text White Space
preserveText.markdownDescription: If text in the provided document code should be preserved exactly as provided. This option eliminates beautification and wrapping of text content.

selfCloseSpace.markdownDescription: Markup self-closing tags end will end with ' />' instead of '/>'

Markup self-closing tags end will end with ' />' instead of '/>' on the ending delimeters.

---

**Disabled**:

	<meta charset="UTF-8">

**Enabled**:

	<meta charset="UTF-8" />

---

**NOTE:**

This is optional and self-closing tags are no longer required as of HTML5, so use this how you wish.

preserveAttributes.markdownDescription: If HTML tags should have their insides (attributes) preserved. This option will prevent attributes from being formatted.

If HTML tags should have their insides (attributes) preserved. This option will prevent attributes from being formatted.

---

**Disabled** üëé

	<div   id="a"
  	class="b" data-attr="c">

**Enabled** üëç

	<div
	 id="a"
	 class="b"
	 data-attr="c">

---

**NOTE:**

There might be some situations where you do not desire attributes to be formatted, in such case use this option.

quoteConvert.markdownDescription: If quotation character should be converted to specific type or not.

oneOf.markdownDescription: Converts single quotes to double quotes
Ignores this option
Converts double quotes to single quotes

correct.title: Fix Sloppy Code
correct.markdownDescription: Automatically attempts to correct some sloppiness in code. Use this option with care, it may wreak havoc in some cases.

braceAllman.title: Style of Indent
braceAllman.markdownDescription: Determines if opening curly braces will exist on the same line as their condition or be forced onto a new line. (Allman style indentation)

comments.markdownDescription: This will determine whether comments should always start at position 0 of each line or if comments should be indented according to the code

classPadding.title: Insert Empty Lines
classPadding.markdownDescription: Inserts new line characters between every CSS code block.

noLeadZero.title: Leading 0s
noLeadZero.markdownDescription: Whether leading 0s in CSS values immediately preceding a decimal should be removed or prevented.

selectorList.title: Single Lined Selectors
selectorList.markdownDescription: If comma separated CSS selectors should present on a single line of code.

quoteConvert.title: Convert Quotes
quoteConvert.markdownDescription: If the quotes of script strings or document attributes should be converted to single quotes or double quotes

oneOf.markdownDescription: Converts single quotes to double quotes
Ignores this option
Converts double quotes to single quotes

correct.title: Fix Sloppy Code
correct.markdownDescription: Automatically attempts to correct some sloppiness in code. Use this option with care, it may wreak havoc in some cases.

braceAllman.title: Style of Indent
braceAllman.markdownDescription: Determines if opening curly braces will exist on the same line as their condition or be forced onto a new line. (Allman style indentation)

braceNewline.title: Brace Lines
braceNewline.markdownDescription: If true an empty line will be inserted after opening curly braces and before closing curly braces

bracePadding.title: Brace Padding
bracePadding.markdownDescription: Inserts a space after the start of a container and before the end of the container if the contents of that container are not indented; such as: conditions, function arguments, and escaped sequences of template strings

oneOf.markdownDescription: Sets options.format_object to 'indent' and options.neverflatten to true
Sets options.bracepadding to true and options.format_object to 'inline'
Sets options.braces to true, options.format_object to 'indent', and options.never flatten to true.
Ignores this option

caseSpace.title: Space Following Case
caseSpace.markdownDescription: If the colon separating a case's expression (of a switch/case block) from its statement should be followed by a space instead of indentation, thereby keeping the case on a single line of code

elseNewline.title: Else On New Line
elseNewline.markdownDescription: If else_line is true then the keyword 'else' is forced onto a new line.

endComma.title: Trailing Comma
endComma.markdownDescription: If there should be a trailing comma in arrays and objects

oneOf.markdownDescription: Always ensure there is a tailing comma
Remove trailing commas
Ignore this option

arrayFormat.title: Formatting Arrays
arrayFormat.markdownDescription: Determines if all array indexes should be indented, never indented, or left to the default.

oneOf.markdownDescription: Default formatting
Always indent each index of an array
Ensure all array indexes appear on a single line

objectIndent.title: Formatting Arrays
objectIndent.markdownDescription: Determines if all object keys should be indented, never indented, or left to the default

oneOf.markdownDescription: Default formatting
Always indent each key/value pair
Ensure all key/value pairs appear on the same single line

functionNameSpace.title: Space After Function Name
functionNameSpace.markdownDescription: If a space should follow a JavaScript function name

methodChain.markdownDescription:
**_METHOD CHAINING_**

_When to break consecutively chained methods and properties onto separate lines. A negative value (eg: `-1`) disables this option. A value of `0` ensures method chains are never broken_

---
#### `0`
Passing a value of `0` will never break chained methods.
```js

window.property.method(() => {}).foo(() => {})


```

---

#### `3` (default)
When there are more than `3` methods and/or properties they will be split onto separate lines.
```js

window
  .property
  .method(() => {})
  .foo(() => {})


```

neverFlatten.title: Never Flatten Destructured Lists
neverFlatten.markdownDescription: If destructured lists in script should never be flattend

noCaseIndent.title: Case Indentation
noCaseIndent.markdownDescription: If a case statement should receive the same indentation as the containing switch block.

noSemicolon.title: No Semicolons
noSemicolon.markdownDescription: Removes semicolons that would be inserted by ASI. This option is in conflict with option 'correct' and takes precedence over conflicting features. Use of this option is a possible security/stability risk

objectSort.markdownDescription:
**_OBJECT SORT_**

_This option will alphabetically sort object properties (keys). This can be an expensive operation when dealing with large objects with over 2k properties._

---
#### Disabled   üëç
When disabled, ie: `false` properties will not be sorted.
```js

{
  e: "5",
  b: "2",
  d: "4",
  a: "1",
  f: "6",
  c: "3"
}


```

---

#### Enabled   üëé
When set to `true` all properties are alphanumerically sorted
```js

{
  a: "1",
  b: "2",
  c: "3",
  d: "4",
  e: "5",
  f: "6"
}


```

quoteConvert.title: Convert Quotes
quoteConvert.markdownDescription: If the quotes of script strings or document attributes should be converted to single quotes or double quotes

oneOf.markdownDescription: Converts single quotes to double quotes
Ignores this option
Converts double quotes to single quotes

functionSpace.title: Function Space
functionSpace.markdownDescription: Inserts a space following the function keyword for anonymous functions

ternaryLine.title: Keep Ternary Statements On One Line
ternaryLine.markdownDescription: If ternary operators in JavaScript ? and : should remain on the same line

variableList.title: Variable Declaration Lists
variableList.markdownDescription: If consecutive JavaScript variables should be merged into a comma separated list or if variables in a list should be separated

vertical.markdownDescription:
**_VERTICAL LIST_**

_If consecutive JavaScript variables should be merged into a comma separated list or if variables in a list should be separated_

---
#### Before Formatting
Below is an example of how this rule works if it's enabled, ie: `true`
```js

const object = {
  someProperty: 'x',
  anotherProperty: 'x',
  fooProperty: 'x'
};


```

---

#### After Formatting
After formatting all declaration lists will be aligned in a vertical manner.
```js

const object = {
  someProperty    : 'x',
  anotherProperty : 'x',
  fooProperty     : 'x'
};


```

arrayFormat.markdownDescription:
**_ARRAY FORMAT_**

_Determines if all array indexes should be indented, never indented, or left to the default. The `default` option will leave array indexes intact and not apply any formatting._

---
#### `inline`   üëé
Ensure all array indexes appear on a single line
```json

{
  "object": [1,2,3,4]
}

```
---
#### `indent`   üëç
Always indent each index of an array

```json

{
  "object": [
    1,
    2,
    3,
    4
  ]
}

```

bracePadding.title: Brace Lines

objectIndent.markdownDescription:
**Object Indent**

Controls how arrays on objects are formatted. We will exclude the `inline` option to prevent unreadable objects. If all object keys should be indented, never indented, or left to the default.

objectSort.markdownDescription:
**_OBJECT SORT_**

_This option will alphabetically sort object properties (keys). This can be an expensive operation when dealing with large objects with over 2k properties._

---
#### Disabled   üëç
When disabled, ie: `false` properties will not be sorted.
```json

{
  "e": "5",
  "b": "2",
  "d": "4",
  "a": "1",
  "f": "6",
  "c": "3"
}

```

---

#### Enabled   üëé
When set to `true` all properties are alphanumerically sorted
```json

{
  "a": "1",
  "b": "2",
  "c": "3",
  "d": "4",
  "e": "5",
  "f": "6"
}

```

items.markdownDescription:
Glob pattern of file's and/or directories to be ignored from formatting. Use relative paths to exclude or ignore formatting.

You can also leverage inline ignore comments. Place a Prettify ignore comment at the top of files you to exclude from beautification.

**Example:**
```liquid
{% # @prettify-ignore %}

OR

<!-- @prettify-ignore -->
```

format.markdownDeprecationMessage: This option is now deprecated. Use the workspace `liquid.format.enable` instead.

wrap.title: Wrap Limit
wrap.markdownDescription: Character width limit before applying word wrap. A `0` value disables this option. Typically, you can leave this option, as it will defaults to the word wrap limit set within workspace/user settings of your text editor.

indentSize.markdownDescription: The level of indentation to be applied to HTML and Liquid syntax. This option does not apply to embedded regions.

commentIndent.markdownDescription: If a blank new line should be forced above comments.

preserveLine.markdownDescription: The maximum number of consecutive empty lines to retain.

preserveComment.title: Eliminate Word Wrap Upon Comments
preserveComment.markdownDescription: Prevent comment reformatting due to option wrap.

endNewLine.markdownDescription: Whether or not to insert a final line. When this rule is undefined in a `.liquidrc` file the Text Editors settings will be used, in vscode that is `*.endWithNewline` where `*` is a language name.  If an `.editorconfig` file is found present in root, those rules will be applied in **precedence** over Text Editor

crlf.markdownDescription: If line termination should be Windows (CRLF) format. Unix (LF) format is the default.

markup.markdownDescription: Liquid + HTML beautification formatting options and rules

script.markdownDescription: JavaScript beautification formatting options and rules. Applied to any defined files, HTML <script> tags and Liquid "javascript" tags

style.markdownDescription: CSS beautification formatting options and rules. Applied to defined "files[]", HTML <style> tags and Liquid "stylesheet" / "style" tags

json.markdownDescription: JSON beautification formattingoptions and rules. Applied to any defined files, HTML <script type="application/json"> tags and Liquid "schema" tags
